meanings.definition: A person who is foolish or stupid, especially when it comes to technology or media.
meanings.sent1: The vidiots in the class always struggle with using computers.
meanings.sent2: She called her friends vidiots when they couldn't figure out how to operate the TV.
meanings.sent3: The vidiots at the movie theater kept talking loudly during the film.
meanings.sent4: He felt like a vidiots trying to fix the broken computer without any knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The image of the vidiots staring blankly at the screen became a common sight in the office.

meanings.definition: The act of behaving foolishly or stupidly, particularly in relation to watching television or videos.
meanings.sent1: Their vidiots during movie night involved making silly comments throughout the film.
meanings.sent2: The siblings' vidiots during the TV show annoyed everyone in the room.
meanings.sent3: The vidiots of the family always managed to spill snacks while watching videos.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a vidiots for binge-watching shows instead of studying.
meanings.sent5: The vidiots of the group kept rewinding the same scene over and over, laughing uncontrollably.
